subject: Re: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
msgSnippet: Did that, doesn t help. ... uses ... However, ... the ... Anyone ... (unnamed) ...
messageBody:
Did that, doesn't help.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Jian Tang wrote:
>
> Try placing it in a named package. JUnit might require/expect it.
>
> > It has no package.
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
> > wrote:
> > > Jian Tang wrote:
> > > > I am using Junit 3.8.1 in windows 2000. My junit test case
uses
> > one
> > > > class called WPFStatDescriptor. Everything compiles fine.
However,
> > > > when I execute the junit test case, it keeps displaying
> > > > java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: WPFStatDescriptor.
> > > >
> > > > I have include the jar file which has WPFStatDescriptor in
the
> > > > CLASSPATH. I am wondering maybe Junit uses a different JVM?
Anyone
> > > > can help me?
> > >
> > > Is WPFStatDescriptor in a named package or the default
(unnamed)
> > package?
> > > --
